thread.title: Huntsmen earn first win of season, beat Unioto
thread.title_full: Huntsmen earn first win of season, beat Unioto

title: Huntsmen earn first win of season, beat Unioto
text:
Huntsmen earn first win of season, beat Unioto Collin Hill 1:07 a.m. EDT October 17, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CHILLICOTHE — While school colors of Huntington High School are green and white; and school colors of Unioto High School are purple and gold; the primary color on the field Friday evening was yellow. 
Flags played a major role in the outcome of this game, but the x-factor was clearly the Huntington defense. Unioto has been nothing short of an offensive monster in recent weeks. 
The Huntsmen were able to stack the box and effectively force the Tanks to take to the air. It was there the Huntsmen showed leaps of improvement and were able to come away with vital turnovers. 
None of those turnovers were more important than a recovery after a Hosely fumble. That carried the momentum away from Unioto in the second half and surrendered it over to the Huntsmen. Huntington never looked back. 
Effectively holding Unioto on four downs from the 1-yard line, the Huntsmen’ defense stood up to the high powered Unioto offense and shut it down, not allowing the Tanks to score. 
The Huntsmen were able to take every shot that Unioto would throw and throw one right back. 
Unioto’s Clay Edler threw for 242 yards and carried the ball 14 times for 35 yards and two total touchdowns. Erique Hosely had seven catches for 49 yards. Read or Share this story: http://ohne.ws/1RNGJeP TOP VIDEOS
